issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: CBO
components.description: All issues dealing with Hive's cost based optimizer and its interaction with Optiq

fields.description: Calcite strict type system throws exception in those cases, which are legal in Hive.
fields.summary: While extracting join conditions follow Hive rules for type conversion instead of Calcite

ATTACHMENT ID: 12744296 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~ashutoshc], thanks for adding that comment.

I'm been checking the patch again, and I'm wondering if it wouldn't be correct to bail out from CBO when the Exception is thrown instead of catching it in those classes, as we may end up hitting other issues if we don't.
For instance, we can bail out in case we hit the Exception when we are checking the cost of a certain join, or in case some of the rules are not applied e.g. HiveInsertExchange4JoinRule which needs to be applied in the return path.
What do you think?
[~jcamachorodriguez] Didn't follow your double negative statements : ) Also, I hadn't updated RB earlier. Just did it. Can you comment there on what you are suggesting?

[~ashutoshc], I checked RB and last version of the patch addresses my concerns about when to bail out of CBO or not.

+1
Should this issue be backported to branch-1? It looks like a bug.
